snippet: The former South African president has been in the hospital for three days, and “his condition is unchanged,” President Jacob Zuma said.
abstract: Former South African Pres Nelson Mandela has been hospitalized again for recurring lung infection, fourth time since late 2012; repeated crises, along with his frail appearance, have stirred concern around the world.
lead_paragraph: The former South African president has been in the hospital for three days, and “his condition is unchanged,” President Jacob Zuma said.

headline.seo: Mandela Back in Hospital With Lung Infection
headline.main: Worry Grows as Mandela Is Unchanged in Hospital
headline.print_headline: Worry Grows As Mandela Remains In Hospital
